intro: Minuartia dianthifolia, commonly known as the rock白菜 or white sandpink, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers with five petals, often arranged in clusters. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia, particularly in mountainous areas. Due to its preference for harsh environments, it is often found in alpine or arctic regions.
